help.title: Help & Shortcuts
help.description: Learn keyboard shortcuts and tips for faster assessment completion.

shortcuts.saveAndNext: Save and go to next question

guide.satisfactoryDesc: Evidence confirms compliance with the protocol question requirements. Documentation is complete and current.
guide.notSatisfactoryDesc: Evidence indicates non-compliance or insufficient implementation. A finding should be documented.
guide.notApplicableDesc: The protocol question does not apply to this organization due to scope or regulatory exemptions.
guide.notReviewedDesc: Question has not yet been assessed. Mark this temporarily while gathering evidence.
guide.levelADesc: Ad-hoc safety management with no systematic approach. Safety activities are reactive and unstructured.
guide.levelBDesc: Safety processes are documented and defined. Basic procedures exist but may not be consistently applied.
guide.levelCDesc: Safety processes are systematically applied and monitored. Performance metrics are tracked.
guide.levelDDesc: Safety performance is measured against targets. Continuous improvement processes are in place.
guide.levelEDesc: Industry-leading safety management with predictive capabilities and proactive risk management.
guide.ansScoring: EI Score is calculated as the percentage of questions marked Satisfactory divided by applicable questions.
guide.smsScoring: Maturity level is determined by the lowest score across all components. Target is typically Level C or higher.

navigation.sidebarTip1: Click any question number to navigate directly to that question.
navigation.sidebarTip2: Questions are color-coded: gray (unanswered), green (satisfactory), red (not satisfactory).
navigation.sidebarTip3: Use the collapse/expand buttons to show or hide sections.
navigation.searchTip1: Use the search box to find questions by text content or question number.
navigation.searchTip2: Filter by response status to quickly find unanswered or flagged questions.
navigation.filtersTip1: Show All: View all questions regardless of status.
navigation.filtersTip2: Unanswered: Focus on questions that still need responses.
navigation.filtersTip3: Flagged: View questions marked for follow-up or review.
navigation.progressTip: The progress bar shows completion percentage. Submit your assessment when you reach 100% or when all required questions are answered.

faq.saveAnswer: Your responses are automatically saved as you work. The status indicator in the header shows when saves are in progress.
faq.editQuestion: Can I edit responses after submitting?
faq.editAnswer: No, once submitted, responses are locked for review integrity. Make sure all responses are complete before submitting.
faq.scoreAnswer: For ANS assessments, the EI score is the percentage of Satisfactory responses. For SMS assessments, maturity is the lowest component level.
faq.accessAnswer: Only users in your organization and assigned reviewers can access your assessment. Admins have full visibility.
faq.evidenceAnswer: Attach documents, procedures, or records that demonstrate compliance. Evidence should be current and clearly support your response.
faq.submitQuestion: When should I submit my assessment?
faq.submitAnswer: Submit when all questions are answered and you've reviewed your responses. You cannot make changes after submission.

settings.title: Assessment Settings
settings.resetConfirmDescription: This will reset all assessment settings to their default values. This action cannot be undone.

permissions.cannotDelete: You don't have permission to delete this assessment
permissions.cannotDeleteSubmitted: Submitted assessments cannot be deleted. You can archive them instead.

statusDescription.DRAFT: Assessment has been created but not started

typeDescription.GAP_ANALYSIS: Identify gaps between current state and requirements
typeDescription.PRE_REVIEW: Preparation assessment before formal peer review

responseDescription.SATISFACTORY: Evidence confirms compliance with the protocol question requirements
responseDescription.NOT_SATISFACTORY: Evidence indicates non-compliance or insufficient implementation
responseDescription.NOT_APPLICABLE: Protocol question is not applicable to this organization
responseDescription.NOT_REVIEWED: Question has not been reviewed yet

maturityDescription.A: Ad-hoc safety management. No systematic approach.
maturityDescription.B: Safety processes are documented and implemented.
maturityDescription.C: Safety processes are systematically applied and monitored.
maturityDescription.D: Safety performance is measured against targets.
maturityDescription.E: Continuous improvement and predictive safety management.

typeDescription.DOCUMENT: Written documentation such as manuals, plans, or policies
typeDescription.PROCEDURE: Documented procedures, work instructions, or guidelines
typeDescription.RECORD: Records of activities, logs, or audit trails
typeDescription.INTERVIEW: Information gathered through interviews or discussions
typeDescription.OBSERVATION: Direct observation of activities or conditions
typeDescription.OTHER: Other types of evidence not fitting above categories

scoring.eiScoreDescription: Effective Implementation score calculated as percentage of satisfactory questions
scoring.smsMaturityDescription: Overall SMS maturity level based on CANSO Standard of Excellence

readOnly.tooltip: This assessment has been finalized. Responses and evidence are preserved for reference.

score.maturityDescription: Overall maturity based on CANSO Standard of Excellence

questionnaire.title: Questionnaires
questionnaire.subtitle: Browse USOAP CMA Protocol Questions and CANSO SoE assessments

ans.title: ANS Questionnaire
ans.description: 851 Protocol Questions across 9 audit areas aligned with ICAO standards for Air Navigation Services oversight

sms.title: SMS Questionnaire
sms.description: Safety Management System maturity assessment across 4 components and 12 study areas

info.title: About the Questionnaires
info.ansDescription: The ANS questionnaire is based on ICAO's Universal Safety Oversight Audit Programme (USOAP) Continuous Monitoring Approach. It evaluates State compliance with international standards across 8 Critical Elements.
info.smsDescription: The SMS questionnaire follows CANSO's Standard of Excellence framework to assess Safety Management System maturity. Organizations are rated from Level A (Informal) to Level E (Excellence).

LEG.name: Legislation
LEG.description: Legislation that provides the foundation for safety oversight and the establishment of a civil aviation authority

ORG.name: Organization
ORG.description: Establishment of a civil aviation authority with adequate staffing, resources and organizational structure

PEL.name: Personnel Licensing
PEL.description: Licensing and certification of aviation personnel including pilots, air traffic controllers, and aircraft maintenance engineers

OPS.name: Operations
OPS.description: Operational requirements for aircraft operators including flight operations, cabin safety, and dangerous goods transport

AIR.name: Airworthiness
AIR.description: Certification and continuing airworthiness of aircraft including type certification and maintenance organizations

AIG.name: Accident Investigation
AIG.description: Investigation of aircraft accidents and incidents to determine causes and formulate safety recommendations

ANS.name: Air Navigation Services
ANS.description: Provision of air traffic services, communications, navigation, surveillance, aeronautical information, and meteorology

AGA.name: Aerodromes
AGA.description: Certification and oversight of aerodromes including physical characteristics, visual aids, and rescue and firefighting services

SSP.name: State Safety Programme
SSP.description: Implementation of a State Safety Programme including safety policy, risk management, assurance, and promotion

CE_1.name: Primary Aviation Legislation
CE_1.description: The provision of a comprehensive and effective aviation law consistent with the environment and complexity of the State's aviation activity, and compliant with the requirements of the Convention on International Civil Aviation

CE_2.name: Specific Operating Regulations
CE_2.description: The provision of adequate regulations to address, at a minimum, national requirements emanating from the primary aviation legislation and providing standardized operational procedures, equipment, and infrastructure in conformity with Standards and Recommended Practices

CE_3.name: State System and Functions
CE_3.description: The establishment of a state aviation system and state safety oversight functions to provide, at a minimum, the appropriate organizational structure, qualified technical personnel, defined responsibilities, and documented policies and procedures

CE_4.name: Qualified Technical Personnel
CE_4.description: The availability of adequate and qualified technical personnel for the performance of state safety oversight functions. Technical personnel requirements include staffing, training, competency, and proficiency

CE_5.name: Guidance, Tools and Provision of Safety-critical Information
CE_5.description: The provision of technical guidance, tools, and safety-critical information to the aviation industry, and within the state aviation system, to enable them to meet the established requirements

CE_6.name: Licensing, Certification, Authorization and/or Approval Obligations
CE_6.description: The implementation of processes and procedures to ensure that aviation personnel and organizations meet the established requirements before they are allowed to perform their functions

CE_7.name: Surveillance Obligations
CE_7.description: The implementation of processes, such as inspections, audits, and monitoring activities, to ensure that aviation licence, certificate, authorization, and approval holders continue to meet the established requirements

CE_8.name: Resolution of Safety Issues
CE_8.description: The implementation of processes and procedures to resolve identified safety issues that have an impact on aviation safety, including enforcement measures

SAFETY_POLICY_OBJECTIVES.name: Safety Policy and Objectives
SAFETY_POLICY_OBJECTIVES.description: Management commitment, safety responsibilities, appointment of key safety personnel, SMS documentation, and safety policy communication

SAFETY_RISK_MANAGEMENT.name: Safety Risk Management
SAFETY_RISK_MANAGEMENT.description: Hazard identification, safety risk assessment and mitigation processes

SAFETY_ASSURANCE.name: Safety Assurance
SAFETY_ASSURANCE.description: Safety performance monitoring and measurement, change management, and continuous improvement

SAFETY_PROMOTION.name: Safety Promotion
SAFETY_PROMOTION.description: Training and education, and safety communication

SA_1_1.name: Safety Policy
SA_1_1.description: Management commitment and responsibility for safety, including the safety policy statement

SA_1_2.name: Safety Accountabilities
SA_1_2.description: Identification of the accountable executive and safety responsibilities of managers

SA_1_3.name: Key Safety Personnel
SA_1_3.description: Appointment of key safety personnel including the safety manager

SA_1_4.name: Emergency Response Planning
SA_1_4.description: Coordination of emergency response planning with appropriate organizations

SA_1_5.name: SMS Documentation
SA_1_5.description: SMS implementation plan, documentation, and records management

SA_2_1.name: Hazard Identification
SA_2_1.description: Processes for identifying hazards through reactive, proactive, and predictive methods

SA_2_2.name: Risk Assessment and Mitigation
SA_2_2.description: Safety risk assessment and development of risk controls and mitigation strategies

SA_3_1.name: Safety Performance Monitoring
SA_3_1.description: Monitoring and measurement of safety performance including SPIs and SPTs

SA_3_2.name: Management of Change
SA_3_2.description: Processes to manage safety risks associated with organizational or operational changes

SA_3_3.name: Continuous Improvement
SA_3_3.description: Internal evaluations, audits, and continuous improvement of the SMS

SA_4_1.name: Training and Education
SA_4_1.description: Safety training programs for personnel at all levels

SA_4_2.name: Safety Communication
SA_4_2.description: Communication of safety-critical information and promotion of safety culture

LEVEL_A.name: Informal
LEVEL_A.description: Ad-hoc safety management activities. No systematic approach. Safety may be addressed reactively.

LEVEL_B.name: Defined
LEVEL_B.description: Safety processes are documented and implemented. Basic compliance with regulatory requirements.

LEVEL_C.name: Managed
LEVEL_C.description: Safety processes are systematically applied and monitored. Safety data is collected and analyzed.

LEVEL_D.name: Assured
LEVEL_D.description: Safety performance is measured against targets. Proactive hazard identification and risk management.

LEVEL_E.name: Excellence
LEVEL_E.description: Continuous improvement and predictive safety management. Industry leader in safety culture.

SPM.name: Safety Performance Management
SPM.description: Cross-cutting area addressing how safety performance is measured and managed across all components

HP.name: Human Performance
HP.description: Cross-cutting area addressing human factors and their impact on safety across all components

CI.name: Continuous Improvement
CI.description: Cross-cutting area addressing how continuous improvement is embedded across all components

superAdmin.title: Super Administrator
superAdmin.description: Full system access with ability to override all restrictions. Manages system configuration and all users.

systemAdmin.title: System Administrator
systemAdmin.description: System configuration and user management. Cannot delete users or override COI restrictions.

steeringCommittee.title: Steering Committee
steeringCommittee.description: Programme oversight and strategic decision-making. Read-only access to all programme data.

programmeCoordinator.title: Programme Coordinator
programmeCoordinator.description: Coordinates peer review activities, assigns review teams, and manages the review schedule.

leadReviewer.title: Lead Reviewer
leadReviewer.description: Leads peer review teams, approves findings, and ensures review quality.

peerReviewer.title: Peer Reviewer
peerReviewer.description: Conducts peer reviews, enters findings, and participates in review teams.

observer.title: Observer
observer.description: Observes peer reviews for training purposes. Read-only access to assigned reviews.

anspAdmin.title: ANSP Administrator
anspAdmin.description: Manages their organization's users, assessments, and peer review participation.

safetyManager.title: Safety Manager
safetyManager.description: Manages safety-related assessments and corrective action plans for their organization.

qualityManager.title: Quality Manager
qualityManager.description: Manages quality assurance assessments and compliance documentation.

staff.title: Staff
staff.description: Basic access to view organization data and complete assigned tasks.

ans.title: ANS USOAP CMA
ans.subtitle: ICAO Universal Safety Oversight Audit Programme
ans.description: Evaluate compliance with ICAO standards across 9 audit areas using the Continuous Monitoring Approach protocol questions.
ans.keyDifference: Best for: Compliance assessment against international aviation safety standards

sms.title: SMS CANSO SoE
sms.subtitle: CANSO Standard of Excellence
sms.description: Assess Safety Management System maturity across 4 components using the CANSO framework with maturity levels A-E.
sms.keyDifference: Best for: SMS maturity assessment and continuous improvement

scoreHelp.title: How scores are calculated:
scoreHelp.expertise: Expertise Match (40 pts): Primary expertise +15, Secondary +5
scoreHelp.language: Language (25 pts): Required languages at operational level
scoreHelp.availability: Availability (25 pts): Coverage during review period
scoreHelp.experience: Experience (10 pts): Past reviews and certifications

coverageHelp.expertise: Percentage of required expertise areas covered by the selected team. 100% means all required areas have at least one team member with that expertise.
coverageHelp.language: Percentage of required languages covered by the team. Team should have native or advanced speakers for each required language.

expertiseHelp.ATS: Air Traffic Services - Control tower, approach, and area control operations
expertiseHelp.AIM_AIS: Aeronautical Information Management - NOTAMs, charts, publications management
expertiseHelp.MET: Meteorology - Aviation weather services, forecasting, and briefing
expertiseHelp.CNS: Communications, Navigation, Surveillance - Technical systems and infrastructure
expertiseHelp.SAR: Search and Rescue - Emergency response coordination and procedures
expertiseHelp.PANS_OPS: Flight Procedures - Instrument approach and departure procedure design
expertiseHelp.SMS_POLICY: Safety Management - Safety policy and objectives
expertiseHelp.SMS_RISK: Safety Risk Management - Hazard identification and risk assessment
expertiseHelp.SMS_ASSURANCE: Safety Assurance - Performance monitoring and compliance
expertiseHelp.SMS_PROMOTION: Safety Promotion - Training and safety communication
expertiseHelp.AERODROME: Aerodrome Operations - Airport operations and management
expertiseHelp.RFF: Rescue and Firefighting - Airport emergency services
expertiseHelp.ENGINEERING: Engineering Services - Infrastructure and technical maintenance
expertiseHelp.QMS: Quality Management System - Quality assurance processes
expertiseHelp.HUMAN_FACTORS: Human Factors - Human performance and error management

languageHelp.title: Working Languages
languageHelp.description: Peer reviews can be conducted in multiple working languages. The team should include members who are fluent in the official working languages of the target organization to ensure effective communication during the review.

request.pageDescription: Submit a request for a peer review of your organization
request.title: Request a Peer Review
request.description: Complete the following steps to request a peer review for your organization.

assessment.title: Select Assessments
assessment.description: Choose which self-assessments should be included in the peer review.
assessment.placeholder: Assessment selection will be available here.
assessment.selectDescription: Select one or more completed self-assessments to include in this peer review request.
assessment.noAssessmentsDescription: You must complete and submit at least one self-assessment before you can request a peer review.
assessment.available: {count, plural, one {# assessment} other {# assessments}} available

scope.title: Define Review Scope
scope.description: Specify the type of review and focus areas.
scope.placeholder: Scope configuration will be available here.

types.ansOnlyDesc: Focus on Air Navigation Services based on the ICAO USOAP CMA 2024 framework. Covers ATS, AIM, MET, CNS, and SAR areas.
types.smsOnlyDesc: Focus on Safety Management System based on the CANSO Standard of Excellence. Covers policy, risk management, assurance, and promotion.
types.comprehensiveDesc: Complete review covering both ANS and SMS aspects. Recommended when both assessment types have been completed.

scope.focusAreasDescription: Select specific areas you would like the review team to focus on. Leave empty for a complete review.

schedule.title: Preferred Schedule
schedule.description: Indicate your preferred dates for the peer review.
schedule.durationDescription: Peer reviews typically last 3-10 days. Requests must be submitted at least 30 days in advance to allow for team assembly and preparation.
schedule.startDateHelp: Earliest available date is 30 days from today
schedule.endDateHelp: Must be 3-10 days after start date

logistics.title: Logistics & Contact
logistics.description: Provide logistics information and primary contact details.

location.onSiteDesc: Review team visits your facility in person for all activities
location.hybridDesc: Combination of on-site visits and remote sessions
location.remoteDesc: Entire review conducted virtually via video conferencing

logistics.accommodationProvided: Accommodation will be provided for the review team
logistics.transportationProvided: Transportation will be arranged for the review team
logistics.languageDescription: Select the primary language for the review activities and reports
logistics.specialRequirementsPlaceholder: Enter any special requirements, accessibility needs, security protocols, or other considerations for the review team...
logistics.specialRequirementsHelp: Include any information that would help the review team prepare for their visit

review.title: Review & Submit
review.confirmDescription: Please review the details below before submitting your peer review request. You can go back to previous steps to make changes.

prerequisites.notMetDescription: Before requesting a peer review, the following requirements must be met:
prerequisites.noAssessmentDescription: You must complete and submit at least one self-assessment before requesting a peer review.

success.title: Request Submitted
success.description: Your peer review request {referenceNumber} has been submitted successfully.

new.pageDescription: Create and schedule a new peer review for an organization
new.title: Schedule New Peer Review
new.description: Create a new peer review by selecting the host organization and configuring review details.

sections.organizationDesc: Select the organization that will be reviewed
sections.reviewTypeDesc: Choose the type and scope of the peer review
sections.logisticsDesc: Configure location, language and accommodation details
sections.contactDesc: Provide the primary contact details for this review

fields.assessmentsDesc: Select the submitted assessments to be reviewed
fields.noAssessments: No submitted assessments available for this organization. The organization must complete and submit a self-assessment first.
fields.focusAreasDesc: Select specific areas to focus on for this review
fields.accommodationDesc: Host organization will provide accommodation for the review team
fields.transportationDesc: Host organization will arrange local transportation
fields.specialRequirementsPlaceholder: Enter any special requirements or notes...
fields.specialRequirementsDesc: Add any additional requirements, constraints, or information relevant to this review

reviewTypes.FULLDesc: Comprehensive review covering all ANS and SMS areas
reviewTypes.FOCUSEDDesc: Targeted review focusing on specific areas
reviewTypes.FOLLOW_UPDesc: Review to verify implementation of previous findings

workflow.workflowDescription: Track the progress of this peer review

confirmDescription.approveRequest: This will approve the review request and move it to the planning stage. The host organization will be notified.
confirmDescription.cancelRequest: This will cancel the review request. This action cannot be undone.
confirmDescription.scheduleReview: This will mark the review as scheduled. Team members will be notified of the confirmed dates.
confirmDescription.startReview: This will mark the review as in progress. The actual start date will be recorded.
confirmDescription.completeFieldwork: This will complete the on-site fieldwork phase and move to report drafting.
confirmDescription.submitForReview: This will submit the report for programme management review.
confirmDescription.finalizeReport: This will finalize the report and mark the review as completed.
confirmDescription.requestRevisions: This will send the report back to the team for revisions.

hints.requested: Review the request details and approve to proceed with team assignment.
hints.needsTeam: Assign a review team with at least one Lead Reviewer and one Reviewer.
hints.needsDates: Set the planned start and end dates for the review.
hints.readyToSchedule: Team and dates are set. Schedule the review to notify participants.
hints.scheduled: Review is scheduled. Start the review when the team is ready to begin fieldwork.
hints.inProgress: Review is in progress. Complete fieldwork when all activities are done.
hints.reportDrafting: Review team is drafting the report. Submit when complete for management review.
hints.reportReview: Report is under review. Approve to finalize or request revisions if needed.

report.pageDescription: View and manage the review report
report.title: Review Report
report.generateSuccessDescription: The report has been generated successfully.
report.noReportDescription: A report has not been generated for this review yet. Click the button below to generate the report.
report.noReportNotAuthorized: A report has not been generated for this review yet. Please contact the review lead to generate the report.
report.unknownError: An unknown error occurred while loading the report.
report.saveSuccessDescription: Your changes have been saved successfully.
report.statusUpdateSuccessDescription: The report status has been updated successfully.
report.exportPDFDescription: PDF export feature will be available soon.
report.executiveSummaryPlaceholderEn: Enter the executive summary in English...
report.executiveSummaryPlaceholderFr: Enter the executive summary in French...

joinRequest.title: Join the Peer Review Programme
joinRequest.subtitle: Submit your organization's application to participate

form.organizationHelp: Only organizations not yet participating in the programme are listed
form.organizationNameHelp: Enter the full official name of your Air Navigation Service Provider
form.organizationCodeHelp: The 4-letter ICAO code for your primary airport (if known)
form.smsMaturityHelp: Based on ICAO SMS implementation phases
form.motivationStatementPlaceholder: Describe why your organization wants to participate in the AFI Peer Review Programme and how it aligns with your safety objectives...
form.proposedReviewerCountHelp: How many qualified reviewers can your organization contribute?
form.additionalNotesPlaceholder: Any other information you would like to share...
form.commitmentLetterHelp: Upload a signed commitment letter from your organization's management

success.title: Application Submitted Successfully
success.message: Your application has been received. The Programme Coordinator will review it and contact you shortly.
success.step1: The Programme Coordinator will review your application
success.step2: If recommended, it will be submitted to the Steering Committee
success.step3: You will be notified of the decision by email

validation.contactEmailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address
validation.motivationRequired: Please provide your motivation for joining
validation.motivationMinLength: Motivation must be at least 100 characters
validation.alreadyActive: Your organization is already an active participant
validation.alreadyPending: Your organization already has a pending application

errors.submitFailed: Failed to submit application. Please try again.

eligibility.title: Eligibility Requirements
eligibility.item1: Air Navigation Service Provider or Civil Aviation Authority in the AFI region
eligibility.item2: Commitment to participate actively in peer reviews (both as host and reviewer)
eligibility.item3: Ability to nominate qualified reviewers for the programme

joinRequestAdmin.title: Join Request Management
joinRequestAdmin.subtitle: Review and process programme participation applications

scReview.title: Steering Committee Decision
scReview.instructions: Review the coordinator's recommendation and make the final decision

success.applicationApproved: Application approved - organization is now ACTIVE
